thread.title: BMC Elections 2017: Here’s why Varun Dhawan couldn’t cast his vote – read details
thread.title_full: BMC Elections 2017: Here’s why Varun Dhawan couldn’t cast his vote – read details

author: Karan Shah
title: BMC Elections 2017: Here’s why Varun Dhawan couldn’t cast his vote – read details
text:
Varun Dhawan in Judwaa 2 and other doubles roles in Bollywood that blew our minds 
The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation Elections 2017 are being conducted today and Mumbaikars are casting votes in hopes of a better future. Being responsible citizens, Bollywood celebrities like Ranveer Singh , John Abraham , Shraddha Kapoor and Anushka Sharma also participated in the polls. However, Varun Dhawan couldn’t cast his vote today. Apparently, Varun’s name was missing from the voter list and hence he wasn’t allowed to cast his vote. Incidentally, his brother, filmmaker Rohit Dhawan, had his name on the list and was able to vote. 
Talking to ANI, a seemingly disappointed Varun revealed, “It is upsetting that I couldn’t find my name on the voter list. This year my name has not shown up on the list, unfortunately. It is bizarre because I voted last year. Will find out from EC where is my name.” The actor believes in exercising his right to vote and had actually flown in from Jaipur early in morning to participate in the BMC elections. Varun was in the Pink city to promote his upcoming film – Badrinath Ki Dulhania . 
Earlier in the day, it was reported that Paresh Rawal had also faced a similar issue. The actor and his wife, Swaroop Sampat, had stepped out early in the morning to cast their votes but upon reaching the polling centre, Paresh could not find his name on the voters’ list at that particular center. Last heard, he was all set to find out the centre where his name was registered in order to exercise his duty to vote. ALSO READ – BMC elections 2017: Anushka Sharma cast her vote first thing in the morning, did you? View pic 
The voting for the BMC (Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation) Elections 2017 began at 7.30 am today and will go on till 6 pm. The first few celebs to vote today included Zoya Akhtar , Rekha, Gulzar and Subhash Ghai. We are expecting a few more celebs to go out and exercise their right to vote. So stay tuned to BollywoodLife as we get you all the details right here…
